noun.name: chair
noun.discription: a piece of furniture for sitting on, typically having a back and four legs

object1.name: table
object1.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a surface for eating, writing, or working

object2.name: sofa
object2.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a long upholstered piece of furniture for seating multiple people, often found in living rooms

object3.name: stool
object3.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a seat without a back or arms, typically resting on three or four legs

object4.name: bench
object4.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a long seat on which multiple people can sit at the same time, often found in parks or public areas

object5.name: desk
object5.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a piece of furniture with a flat or sloping surface, used for writing, reading, or using a computer

object6.name: bed
object6.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a piece of furniture used for sleeping or resting, typically consisting of a flat surface and a headboard

object7.name: couch
object7.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a long upholstered piece of furniture for seating multiple people, similar to a sofa but often more informal

object8.name: rocking chair
object8.discription: in parallel with 'chair', is a type of chair with two curved bands (rockers) attached to the bottom of the legs, allowing the chair to rock back and forth
